158435-d-05-11-00-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN 570-09 ARRIVED AT VALLEY CITY AT 1605, STOPPED AT ABOUT MP 290 TO WAIT FOR M.O.W. TO CLEAR MACHINERY. M.O.W. WAS WORKING EAST OF MP 286 AND CAME BACK TO THE HOUSE TRACK TO CLEAR ON THE WEST END.THE MACHNERY WAS PULLED WEST OF THE SWTCH, THE REGULATOR OPERATOR OPENED THE SWTCH, PULLED THE REGULATOR NTO THE CLEAR, THEN THE TAMPER FOLLOWED THE REGULATOR IN THE CLEAR.  THE REGULATOR OPERATOR WENT TO USE THE RESTROOM IN THE SECTION HOUSE.  THE TAMPER OPERATOR GRABBED A LOCK OUT TAG AND WENT TO THE SWITCH,  LOCKED AND TAGGED THE SWITCH IN THE OPEN POSITION AND CLEARED HIS TRACK WARRANT AT 1620 HOURS AND THEN WENT TO THE SECTION HOUSE TO DO HIS PAPERWORK.  M.O.W.  LEFT THE DERAL IN THE OFFPOSITION.  TRAIN 570-09 THEN PROCEEDED EASTWARD INTO VALLEY CITY.  AS THEY CAME AROUND THE CURVE, JUST WEST OF THE EAST SWITCH, THEY SAW THAT THE SWITCH TARGET WAS RED.  THE ENGINEER PUT THE TRAIN INTO EMERGENCY.  TRAIN COULD NOT STOP PRIOR TO ENTERING THE HOUSE TRACK AND STRUCK THE M.O.W. EQUIPMENT.    ESTIMATED DAMAGE TO TAMPER IS $50,000  AND LOCOMOTIVE DAMAGE IS ESTIMATED AT $3,000.  NO INJURIES WERE REPORTED.   APPROXIMATELY  1/2 GALLON OF HYDRAULIC FLUID WAS RELEASED ONTO THE BALLAST BY THE TAMPER.   ALL APPROPRIATE ENTITIES WERE NOTIFIED.   M.O.W. CREW MEMBERS WERE UHR TESTED.NoneNone

200005019-d-05-25-00-PTRA.Narrative: JOB 236 WAS ATTEMPTING TO DROP THREE LOADED TANK CARS FROM TRACK 29-105 INTO TRACK 29-116.  JOB 236EARLIER HAD LEFT HOPPER CAR PLCX 44128 STANDING ON TRACK 29-105 APPROXIMATELY NINE CAR LENGTHS SOUTHOF THE 29-116 SWITCH STAND.  JOB 236 THEN PROCEEDED TO A POINT NORTH OF SWITCH STAND WITH THREE LOADED TANK CARS COUPLED TO NORTH END OF THEIR TWO UNITS.  JOB 236 THEN ATTEMPTED TO DROP THREE TANK CARS INTO TRACK 29-116.  ENGINEER BEGAN ACCELLERATING HIS UNITS TO BUILD SPEED TO SEPARATE HIS UNITS FROM THE THREE CARS.  FOREMAN RIDING NORTH UNIT 9608 PULLED PIN ON THREE TANK CARS TO RELEASE THEM BEFORE REACHING SWITCH FOR TRACK 116.  HELPER WAS STANDING AT THE 116 SWITCH TO LINE THREE CARS INTO TRACK 116 FELT THERE WAS INSUFFICIENT SEPARATION BETWEEN TWO UNITS AND THE THREE CARS FOR HIM TO LINETHE 116 SWITCH AS THEY APPROACHED.  UNITS 9609 AND 9608 PASSED OVER SWITCH HEADED SOUTH ON TRACK 105 DURING ATTEMPTED DROP MOVEMENT.  ENGINEER WAS UNABLE TO STOP BEFORE COLLIDING WITH STANDING HOPPERCAR PLCX 44128.  THEN THE THREE TANK CARS SEPARATED FROM NORTH END OF THEIR UNITS PROCEEDED SOUTH AFTER SWITCH FOR 116 COULD NOT BE LINED AND COLLIDED WITH UNIT 9608, CAUSING DAMAGE TO BOTH THE 9608AND 9609.NoneNone

BA0518001-d-05-18-00-BAR.Accident Cause: Failure to apply hand brakes on car(s) (railroad employee)
BA0518001-d-05-18-00-BAR.Narrative: NO 216, WHILE IN THE PROCESS OF SWITCHING SHOPS ON TRACK 38 AT OAKFIELD, SET THREE CARS, INCLUDING BAR 13019, ON THE MAIN TRACK JUST CLEAR (NORTH) OF SOUTH LADDER BY APPROXIMATELY ONE CAR LENGTH.  BEFORE CUTTING AWAY FROM THE THREE SHOPS THEY DUMPED THE AIR PRESUMABLY SETTING THE BRAKES ON THE STANDING EQUIPMENT.  THEY THEN SHOVED NORTH BACK INTO TRACK 38, MADE THE HITCH AND STARTED TO PUMP TRACK38 OFF.  MEANWHILE, THE THREE CARS THAT WERE LEFT ON THE MAIN LINE ROLLED SOUTH STRIKING LOCOMOTIVE300 AND BAR 3456.  THE FUEL TANK ON LOCOMOTIVE 300 WAS RUPTURED BY THE RAKING COLLISION RESULTING INTHE LEAKAGE OF APPROXIMATELY 400 GALLONS OF DIESEL FUEL.  NO EQUIPMENT WAS DERAILED.  LOCOMOTIVE 300 SUSTAINED 11,770 SIDE DAMAGE, INCLUDING A RUPTURED TANK, SAFETY APPLIANCE AND BATTERY COVER DAMAGE.  BAR 13019 SUSTAINED 800.00 DAMAGE WHICH INCLUDED AR CORNER, R11 SIDE POST, AR SIDE AND END LADDERDAMAGE.  BAR 3456 SUSTAINED 600.00 DAMAGE WHICH INCLUDED DAMAGE TO THE AR CORNER.  THE CONDUCTOR STATED THAT HE HAD NOT APPLIED ANY HAND BRAKES ON THE STANDING EQUIPMENT.  ALL THREE OF THE CARS LEFTON THE MAIN TRACK WERE SHOPPED FOR AIR BRAKE PROBLEMS.  SHOP TAGS WERE APPLIED TO THE SHOPPED EQUIPMENT, HOWEVER THE CONDUCTOR'S LIST DID NOT REFLECT THE NATURE OF THE DEFECTS.  THE FUEL SPILLED WAS CLEANED UP UNDER THE SUPERVISION OF THE MAIN DEP.None
